revised_title: Optimal Composition and Process for Reflecting Telescope Speculums
tldr: The author describes a new composition for reflecting telescope speculums, using a mixture of Swedish copper and grain-tin, and outlines a process to prevent pores and maintain hardness and whiteness. The method involves melting the copper and tin together, casting the metal into an ingot, and then melting it again before pouring into molds. This composition and process improve the reflective powers and durability of the speculum.
